channel.title: Comments on: Interview With Louis Davidson Author of Pro SQL Server 2008 Relational Database Design and Implementation
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: Well, I assume no more free copies are left?
item.content:encoded: Well, I assume no more free copies are left?

item.title: By: chopstik
item.dc:creator: chopstik
item.description: Very nice... I don't do as much with DB's now as I used to but would like to get back to it... I think I prefer working with DB's now more than front end applications... Seems - cleaner - somehow... Thanks for the excellent interview!
item.content:encoded: Very nice… I don’t do as much with DB’s now as I used to but would like to get back to it… I think I prefer working with DB’s now more than front end applications… Seems – cleaner – somehow… Thanks for the excellent interview!

item.title: By: Louis Davidson
item.dc:creator: Louis Davidson
item.description: To those of you who mentioned you would check out the book, check out the last section of the interview. Still one copy left!
item.content:encoded: To those of you who mentioned you would check out the book, check out the last section of the interview. Still one copy left!

item.title: By: Pythian Group Blog
item.dc:creator: Pythian Group Blog
item.description: <strong>Log Buffer #116: A Carnival of the Vanities for DBAs</strong><br />Welcome to the 115th edition of Log Buffer, the weekly review of database blogs.<br /> This was the week of Oracle Open World (OOW), Oracle’s gigantic annual get-together in San Francisco — always the heaviest week in Oracle blogs, so let’s...
item.content:encoded:
Log Buffer #116: A Carnival of the Vanities for DBAs
Welcome to the 115th edition of Log Buffer, the weekly review of database blogs.
This was the week of Oracle Open World (OOW), Oracle’s gigantic annual get-together in San Francisco — always the heaviest week in Oracle blogs, so let’s…

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Paul his books are written in a similar matter. It is not your typical dry textbook. I highly recommend Louis’ books

Find out yourself, download chapter one here: http://www.apress.com/book/downloadfile/4090

item.title: By: Paul
item.dc:creator: Paul
item.content:encoded:
I just love this guy, and this is my first exposure to his relaxed, humorous interview style. Are his books this engaging, too?

Man, if I’m ever in Nashville, I’d gladly have a fried chicken meal with you, and I would even pick up the check.

(sorry if this comment was of little use to anyone)

item.title: By: Jerry Hung
item.dc:creator: Jerry Hung
item.description: Great interview<br /> I have the Pro SQL 2005 book right beside me (unfinished), darn, now I have to hunt down the hidden message ;-)
item.content:encoded:
Great interview
I have the Pro SQL 2005 book right beside me (unfinished), darn, now I have to hunt down the hidden message ðŸ˜‰

item.description: I will check it out too.

item.description: Great interview, will have to check the book out
